intro: Bosistoa selwynii, commonly known as Selwyn's bosistoa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, leathery leaves and showy, red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with dense, compact growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
